page.title: 05 Communications
page.content: The estuary of the River Neath is ideally suited for heavy industrial use:it is wide, land has been excavated to produce dock facilities, and the river are accessible from the surrounding coastal landscape.This location coincides with the lowest bridging point, and it is backed by a large hinterland in the South Wales industrial region. The nature of the industry in this region has declined in the recent years, and the river area shows several examples of this decline. The dock area , and some of the landing stages are now disused. Physically,the River Neath is typical of many esturine locations.The river enters Swansea Bay at this point,and silt and extrusive areas predominate a natural channel is evident.The Boats which are moored here suggest leisure rather than industrial activity.
